name: Max Verstappen
strengths: Aggressive racing style with instinctive racecraft and strong performance in wet conditions:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}:contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
weaknesses: Overly aggressive driving early in career led to collisions and penalties:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

name: Yuki Tsunoda
strengths: Fast and aggressive driver with strong qualifying and race pace:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
weaknesses: Emotional radio style and fiery temperament can hurt consistency:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

name: Liam Lawson
strengths: Proven success in junior categories (F2 race wins) indicating good raw speed
weaknesses: Limited F1 experience led to struggles with car balance and qualifying pace:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

name: George Russell
strengths: Brilliant baseline speed and qualifying pace:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}; strong racecraft and overtaking commitment:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}
weaknesses: Relatively few glaring weaknesses; continues to mature with leadership role

name: Andrea Kimi Antonelli
strengths: Exceptional wet-weather performance and brave overtakes in junior series (e.g. Eau Rouge move):contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}
weaknesses: Lack of F1 experience, rookie consistency

name: Charles Leclerc
strengths: Fast qualifier and strong racer; quick rise from Sauber debut 2018:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}
weaknesses: Sometimes loses performance on tires over long runs
preferred_circuits: Street circuits (e.g. Monaco) and technical tracks

name: Lewis Hamilton
strengths: Exceptionally consistent (scored in all races in 2017) and raw speed:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}; excellent qualifying record
weaknesses: Occasional errors under pressure when focused on championships

name: Fernando Alonso
strengths: Vast experience with top-level racecraft and tire management:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}; tactical racing (protects tires)
weaknesses: Can employ aggressive gamesmanship tactics

name: Lance Stroll
strengths: Has shown strong performance in chaotic and wet races (Azerbaijan 2017, pole in rain at Turkey 2020)
weaknesses: Inconsistency and struggles in clean qualifying

name: Lando Norris
strengths: Excellent qualifying pace and tenacious wheel-to-wheel racing:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}; breakthrough race wins
weaknesses: Occasionally prone to minor racing mistakes

name: Oscar Piastri
strengths: Rapid adaptation and consistency (F2 champion) and delivered podiums and wins in 2023–24:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}:contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}
weaknesses: Relatively less F1 experience, but quickly overcoming initial weaknesses

name: Pierre Gasly
strengths: Excels at extracting performance from midfield cars (won 2020 Italian GP with AlphaTauri):contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}
weaknesses: Inconsistent qualifying pace when car limits are high

name: Jack Doohan
strengths: Successful junior career (multiple F3 and F2 race wins) suggests strong racecraft:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}
weaknesses: Struggled in initial F1 races and was replaced after few rounds:contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}

name: Franco Colapinto
strengths: Impressively fast in limited outings (first Argentine F1 driver in 23 years):contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}
weaknesses: Very short experience on 2025 car

name: Oliver Bearman
strengths: Strong rookie showing (points finish in debut F1 race):contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}
weaknesses: Made early rookie errors (Monaco practice penalty) under pressure

name: Esteban Ocon
strengths: High determination and consistency; scored Alpine's first win (2021 Hungary):contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}
weaknesses: Often conservative racing, avoids unnecessary risks

name: Nico Hülkenberg
strengths: Reliable and consistent performer, helps develop the car; strong average race pace
weaknesses: Lacks outright pace for podiums, has no F1 wins despite many starts

name: Gabriel Bortoleto
strengths: F2 champion with notable speed, expected to be fast in his rookie year
weaknesses: No F1 experience yet

name: Isack Hadjar
strengths: F2 champion with impressive junior results, poised for speed
weaknesses: F1 rookie, likely to need time to adapt

name: Alexander Albon
strengths: Known for overtaking skill and qualifying speed:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}; strong mid-pack racer
weaknesses: Struggled when pressured to match top-tier teammate

name: Carlos Sainz Jr.
strengths: Seasoned and consistent performer, capable of podiums (multiple career wins)
weaknesses: Can be outpaced by teammates, no standout weakness
